snippet.title: Joe backs Exum to be on song at Jazz
snippet.content: AUSTRALIAN NBA swingman Joe Ingles believes Dante Exum has a "huge opportunity" to cement his place at Utah Jazz. Ingles, 29, plans to do everything he can to help the No.5 overall pick in the 2014 draft build on a breakout Summer League. NBLxNBA: INGLES: Through three NBA Summer League games in Utah, Melbourne-born Exum averaged 20 points per game on better than 52 per cent shooting - well above his career mark of 38.5 per cent. On top of improved shot selection, Exum, 22, showed great playmaking ability, dropping 6.3 assists a game, impressing with his ability to run an NBA offence. The highly-regarded Boomer missed the entire 2015-16 season with a torn ACL and struggled to find his feet last season, prompting Jazz officials to question his prospects. Exum's strong off-season, coupled with the departure of star swingman Gordon Hayward (Boston Celtics) could see the high school phenom attract more minutes. "He's been working his ass off this off-season to be ready to go and he knows what he has to do," Ingles said. "He's smart enough, he's a good kid and again he's a got a good opportunity this year to get out there and have a crack. "There's no pressure. (When) you lose a guy like Gordon it changes your team, there's going to be 20 more shots open, there's going to be 35 minutes in that position, there's a lot of things that have changed now for our team." The 1.98m combo guard, in the final year of his rookie contract, must produce at NBA level to secure a hefty pay rise. Jazz arrivals Ricky Rubio and lottery pick Donovan Mitchell could take valuable court-time off Exum, but Ingles is confident the Boomers young gun can fill a hole. "We've obviously brought guys in to help, but we're not going to be able to replace Gordon just overnight like that," Ingles said. "He's (Exum) going to have a great opportunity to showcase what he's done in this off-season and ... obviously I'm going to do everything I can to help him have a really good year." Ingles and Exum's Jazz will take on the NBL's Sydney Kings in a special exhibition match in Salt Lake City on October 3.
